description:
In case of multiple compute nodes each having its /var/lib/nova/instances directory mounted via NFS from shared storage server, Nova gathers free space statistics from each compute node and adds them, making the theoretical total disk space equal N times the real one (N is the number of nodes we have).

There is no way currently to tell nova not to do that. It could be easily done by examining /var/lib/nova/instances/compute_nodes files which says what compute nodes use that storage. Nova could then count only one of these nodes to have a real value.

This problem affects scheduling and nova hypervisor statistics.

Maillist conversation: http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack/2013-November/002763.html
title: Nova counts NFS shared storage space on each node

comments.content: I'm fuzzy about what part of the scheduler or nova actually needs to have the total compute node space summed across all hypervisor hosts.  It seems to me that any attempt to sum the disk space across all hypervisors is broken by design and we need to rethink what we're actually trying to accomplish here. Simply not double-counting NFS space is insufficient IMHO
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~berrange

comments.content:
Hi Daniel, as an user, I do believe I need to know the total disk used by our system. So I can have a plan to add more storage to the system. 
On the other hand, I do not care how much disk space on each nova compute node, because I think openstack will resize the virtual machine automatically to suite the storage.
